Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2008 05:23AM Elliemae32 wrote: I just had a modified radical mastectomy on Tuesday.  I am 32 yo with a 19month old little boy and 19 weeks pregnant.  I was released home on Wednesday upon my request.  I was only taking tylenol for the pain and an occasional percocet when I couldn't get comfy and the drains were bothering me.  I have 3 drains b/c I had 18 lymph nodes removed.  They are the worst part.  I did find an old purse that was soft and the strap was long enough to be worn over the head and across the chest.  I put my drains in there so my son doesn't want to investigate as much.  It's funny, every time someone comes over, they think I was just about to leave since I have my purse on!  Overall the area does not hurt b/c I have a lot of numb places where the nerves were cut.  Like I said the drains are giving me the biggest headaches, but they come out on Monday!  Let me tell you that this surgery is sooo much easier than a c-section! Ellen
Posts.Title: afraid of pain dakotaseas Elliemae32

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2008 09:55AM Elliemae32 wrote: I have been matched up with a mentor from pregnant with cancer and she is 13 years out with no recurrence from triple negative.
Posts.Title: Boost my spirits...long term trip neg mets stories please AlaskaDeb twink

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2008 09:50AM Elliemae32 wrote: Kiwi, I am in the same situation you are in.  I found the lump just after my + pregnancy test in Feb but wasn't diagnosed until late may after the lump was removed.  In my case I am triple negative so I can't take tamoxifen after wards and chemo is my only "drug" to keep this from coming back.  I had a mastectomy at 18 weeks.  My oncologist didn't want to start chemo until after 20 weeks.  By then all of the organs are developed, the baby is just getting bigger.  I also got a second opinion at a large teaching hospital and she recommended a more aggressive chemo than my local oncologist.  They also said that they schedule the delivery around your blood levels and chemo.  The goal is still a 39 week baby.  I started FAC chemo (you can google it) on 6-27.  I also joined both pregnant with cancer network and young survivors.  Both are GREAT!!  Pregnant with cancer matched me up with a woman who has been through it already.  My mentor's chemo baby is now 14 and perfect!!  Young survivors has a pregnancy board.  Most of the posters are trying to get pregnant after chemo but there are a few like me who are going through it now.  I just posted there about starting chemo and at least 10 women responded who have been through it.  All of them said the them said that the hormones from pregnancy "protected" them from the nausea and yucky feelings.  I will also say that I had no problems with my first treatment also aside from falling asleep at 8:30 on the couch the week after treatment.... was it from the chemo or being 5 months pregnant with a 20 month old toddler?  Who knows.   Most of them also said that they were bald mamas at delivery while their baby had a full head of hair!!  Most pregnant women get AC therapy since they are old effective drugs.  There are many case studies that these drugs are safe for the baby after the first trimester.    Let men know if I can help you in any way, I have done ALOT of research.  Ellen
Posts.Title: chemo while pregnant??? kiwi72 DoreenF

Posts.Title: tell me if my lymphedema therapist is crazy Elliemae32 kira

Posts.Content: Elliemae32 wrote: I have only met with her once so far for measurements and a consult.  I asked for a referral b/c i felt my wrist and elbow were getting sore and my arm was a little puffier than the other one.  She took measurements and said that I needed to wear a compression shirt and shorts that overlap.  She doesn't want the lymph to "get stuck" in my midsection.  I have VERY mild lymphedema with my measurements only being 1 cm larger in a few spots.  I will have to see her 4 days a week for 3 weeks then 2 days a week for 2 weeks.... Does any of this sound normal?  She just seemed a little strange and even made a comment about not wanting to get radiation on her hands since I am still getting radiation.--- she may have been joking---  I will check her out more once the appts start.  Thanks, Ellen My treatment buddy was born October 23rd and is a perfect little boy! Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2008 09:07AM Elliemae32 wrote: Kathy, I have infiltrating Duct Cell Carcinoma.  3.5cm grade 2 lesion, triple negative.  I have a 19 month old son and am pregnant with #2 (I think it is a boy, but we will find out on the 17th!!)  he/she is due Nov 8th.  I am having a mastectomy with complete node removal on June 10th since I can't have the radioactive tracer or radiation.  My oncololgist wants to get the baby to 20 weeks before I start chemo.  He thinks it will be early July (the baby will be 21 to 22 weeks then).  I will be getting AC therapy we think.  I am going to get a second chemo opinion at UNC-Chapel Hill.  My local oncologist has never treated a pregnant pt so I think the more MD's thinking about my case the better!  Are there any suggestions for my upcoming surgery.  All I can think about is to take a button up shirt since I won't be able to lift my arm... anything else?  Thanks,   Ellen
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2008 09:43PM Elliemae32 wrote: I'm home!  I had surgery yesterday and I was released this evening.  The MD finally came to see me at 6pm and I was home by 8pm!  I am not in any pain except for the headache I keep getting from caffeine withdrawal!  My husband will be changing my dressings and I get my 3 drains out on Monday.  Hopefully I will get the results from the nodes on Friday.  He said some of them were enlarged, but that could easily be from having the lump removed 2 weeks earlier.  Fingers Crossed, Ellen

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2009 01:35PM Elliemae32 wrote: I just had my ovaries and uterus removed in October during my c-section.  I have been taking Effexor XR 75mg for the hot flashes.  It is working wonderfully.  I have also been taking melatonin at bedtime to help me sleep for the last week.  I feel like a new woman!!  Good luck, Ellen
